thread.title: Hisham: N. Korean ambassador crossed the line - Nation
thread.title_full: Hisham: N. Korean ambassador crossed the line - Nation | The Star Online

author: thestar.com.my
title: Hisham: N. Korean ambassador crossed the line - Nation
text:
PORT KLANG: North Korea's Ambassador to Malaysia stepped over the line with his outburst and allegations against Malaysia, says Datuk Seri Hishammuddin Tun Hussein.
"There were diplomatic irregularities and I think the ambassador was rude in his comments,'' said the Defence Minister, commenting on remarks made by Kang Chol, North Korea's Ambassador to Malaysia
Hishammuddin said investigations into the assassination of Kim Jong-nam were in the good hands of the Malaysian police who had proven to the world they were capable of handling the case by the speedy arrests made.
"Now we have to ensure that everything proceeds in a well-planned manner,'' Hishammuddin told reporters after receiving volunteers returning home from the Food Flotilla For Myanmar mission.
He added that investigations into any criminal case are conducted in accordance with the laws of the country as well as with the standards of international law.
Four suspects have so far been arrested in connection with the assassination of Kim Jong-nam, the half-brother of North Korean leader Kim Jong-un.
Those arrested are female suspects Doan Thi Huong, 28, who holds a Vietnamese passport; Indonesian Siti Aisyah, 25, and her Malaysian boyfriend Muhammad Farid Jalaluddin, as well as North Korean Ri Jong-chol, 47.
Four other suspects are believed to be back in Pyongyang after leaving the country for Jakarta immediately after the attack on Jong-nam.
